page.title: 10West Wratting: Livestock
page.content: The land in the survey area is predominantly used for cereals . However, one square kilometre in the area is currently mostly growing beet. There are no dairy cattle but some beef cattle are reared here and fattened on the hay pastures through the winter.Sheep are over-wintered at one of the farms and go elsewhere to lamb in April. There are several horses kept for foxhunting in the area. The foxes take young pheasants from the copses.A gamekeeper who is responsible for the management of the copses on the whole estate rears pheasants and organises commercial shoots. (See page on Recreation.)
